Name: Arusha
Description: A major tourist hub near Serengeti and Kilimanjaro.

Name: Dar es Salaam
Description: Tanzania s largest city and economic center.

Name: Dodoma
Description: The capital city and political center of Tanzania.

Name: Geita
Description: A gold-rich region in northwestern Tanzania.

Name: Iringa
Description: Known for Ruaha National Park and agriculture.

Name: Kagera
Description: A coffee-growing region bordering Uganda and Rwanda.

Name: Katavi
Description: A remote region with vast wilderness areas.

Name: Kigoma
Description: A region along Lake Tanganyika with fishing and trade.

Name: Kilimanjaro
Description: Home to Mount Kilimanjaro, Africa s highest peak.

Name: Lindi
Description: A coastal region with rich history and natural gas reserves.

Name: Manyara
Description: Known for Tarangire National Park and farming.

Name: Mara
Description: Part of the Serengeti and rich in wildlife.

Name: Mbeya
Description: A fertile agricultural region in the southwest.

Name: Morogoro
Description: A key farming and industrial region.

Name: Mtwara
Description: A southern coastal region with cashew farming.

Name: Mwanza
Description: A major trade and fishing center on Lake Victoria.

Name: Njombe
Description: A highland region known for tea and timber production.

Name: Pemba North
Description: An island region part of Zanzibar.

Name: Pemba South
Description: A part of Zanzibar with clove farming.

Name: Pwani
Description: A coastal region near Dar es Salaam.

Name: Rukwa
Description: A remote western region with agriculture.

Name: Ruvuma
Description: A southern region known for the Selous Game Reserve.

Name: Shinyanga
Description: A region with mining and cotton farming.

Name: Simiyu
Description: A new region formed in 2012, with agriculture and cattle.

Name: Singida
Description: A central region with semi-arid climate.

Name: Songwe
Description: A new region formed in 2016 from Mbeya.

Name: Tabora
Description: A central region known for tobacco farming.

Name: Tanga
Description: A coastal region with tea and sisal farming.

Name: Zanzibar North
Description: A tourism-heavy part of Zanzibar.

Name: Zanzibar South
Description: Known for beaches and spice farming.

Name: Zanzibar West
Description: Includes Stone Town, Zanzibar s historic center.
